data.title: Where the original Kill Bill cast are as the movie celebrates its 20 year anniversary
data.meta_description: As Quentin Tarantino's iconic action-thriller Kill bill celebrates its 20th anniversary this week we're taking a closer look at what the original cast of the movie are doing two decades later
data.text:
As Kill Bill celebrates it's 20 year anniversary since first being theatrically released, we're taking a closer look at where the core cast from the classic action thriller are now.

Quentin Tarantino's iconic film Kill Bill: Volume 1 is now celebrating two decades of entertaining audiences after the hit Blockbuster originally released in 2003. The film followed The Bride are her mission for revenge against the Deadly Viper Assassination Squad, who betrayed and left her for dead on her wedding day.

From the unforgettable yellow jumpsuit to the jaw-dropping fight scenes Kill Bill has become a cult classic loved by adventure lovers everywhere. As the movie celebrates this exciting milestone we're taking a look at what the core cast are up to now from a passionate environmentalist to a strange untimely death.

READ MORE: Where is the Hocus Pocus cast now 30 years on — from award-winning singer to top model

Uma Thurman

Uma Thurman starred as the main character Beatrix Kiddo, also known as "Black Mamba" and "The Bride" in the Kill Bill franchise. After she left her assassination career after becoming pregnant, Uma set off to start a new life. But as she was getting ready for her wedding ceremony all of her friends and finance were murdered at the rehearsal. After being shot in the head and falling into a four-year coma, Uma wakes to seek revenge against members of the Deadly Viper Assassination including Bill.

Since Kill Bill, Uma has gone on to star in a number of successful Blockbusters showing her incredible range starring in movies across many genres including action thrillers, science fiction, and romantic comedies. Some of Uma's most memorable performances include her roles in Pulp Fiction, Henry & June, Batman & Robin, Les Miserables, The Lightning Thief, and many more. As of this year Uma starred in a new movie last month as an art dealer in the thriller The Kill Room alongside Samuel L. Jackson.

Following the release of Kill Bill, Uma revealed that she nearly died on set during one of her daring scenes when Tarantino made her drive a stunt car herself. In an interview with the New York Times, Uma said: "The steering wheel was at my belly and my legs were jammed under me. I felt this searing pain and thought, ‘Oh my God, I’m never going to walk again,'" she continued: "When I came back from the hospital in a neck brace with my knees damaged and a large massive egg on my head and a concussion, I wanted to see the car and I was very upset. Quentin and I had an enormous fight, and I accused him of trying to kill me. And he was very angry at that, I guess understandably, because he didn’t feel he had tried to kill me.”

Lucy Liu

In Kill Bill Lucy Liu starred as O-Ren Ishii, was one of the villains of the movie and was known for being unforgiving and emotionless. O-Ren was a member of the Deadly Viper Assassination Squad known by her secret code-name "Cottonmouth" who has became the leader of the Japanese Yakuza. At the young age of nine, O-Ren witnessed the death of her parents by the Yakuza boss, Boss Matsumoto.

Outside of Kill Bill Lucy Liu is famous for her iconic role as the intelligent and alluring Alex Munday in two Charlie's Angels films. Lucy has starred in a number of famous films throughout her acting career including Payback, Shanghai Noon, Chicago, Lucky Number Slevin, Watching the Detectives, among many more. Lucy also worked as a voice actor starring in a number of popular films including Kung Fu Panda, Silvermist, the Tinker Bell series, Mulan II, and more.

Outside of acting Lucy is also an artist and has participated in several gallery shows that have showcased her work. Lucy creates art in a number of medias including collages, paintings, and photography and has been doing so since was 16 years old and even went to college for it. Lucy attended the New York Studio School for drawing, painting, and sculpture from 2004 to 2006.

Following her role as O-Ren Ishii, Lucy spoke about her character in an interview with IGN and said: "I thought she was a really cool character to play because she was a survivor, you know what I mean? She had so many reasons why she had become what she was," she continued: "He (Tarantino) pretty much lays it out for you...O-Ren Ishii wasn't the type of person who was ever gonna die peacefully in her bed, you know what I mean? She was going to die fighting and that was how it was gonna be."

Michael Madsen

Michael Madsen starred as Budd in Kill Bill. In the movie Budd whose code name was "Sidewinder" was Bill's younger degenerate brother. In the action thriller Budd was known by Bill as "the only man [he] ever loved" and was the only other male in the Deadly Viper.

Since Kill Bill, Michael has starred in a number of Quentin Tarantino's successful films including Reservoir Dogs, The Hateful Eight, and Once Upon a Time in Hollywood. Outside of working with the famous director, Michael has had a long successful career in Hollywood spanning 40 years and landing roles in 170 films some of which include The Natural, The Doors, Thelma & Louise, Free Willy, Donnie Brasco, and many more.

Outside of acting, Michael has also started his own business launching a line of hot sauces called American Badass. For his line of condiments he whipped up his own special recipes and went on to create delicious and spicy hot sauce, mustard, and BBQ sauce.

Daryl Hannah

Daryl Hannah played Elle Driver in the original Kill Bill movie. Elle was one of the members of the Deadly Viper Assassination Squad and was known by her code-name "California Mountain Snake." Elle was known as being the least sympathetic and possibly the cruelest of the group. After a fight in Budd's trailer, Elle was defeated by Beatrix, who ripped out her other eye making her completely blind and forced to wear an eyepatch. In the movie Elle had some kind of sexual relationship with Bill.

Outside of Kill Bill Daryl has gone on to star in many films and landed roles in 52 movies over her career in Hollywood. Some of Daryl's most well-known performances include her roles in Blade Runner, Wall Street, Steel Magnolias, Summer Lovers, among many more. Daryl has also created works herself as she wrote, directed, and produced the film The Last Supper and the documentary Strip Notes.

Outside of the entertainment industry Daryl is a passionate environmental activist and has been arrested more than once fighting for what she believes in. In 2016, Hannah was arrested for her involvement with over 350 farmers and their families as they confronted authorities bulldozing the largest urban farm in the U.S. in South Central Los Angeles. In protest Daryl chained herself to a walnut tree at South Central Farm to show her support for the owners keeping their land. In another instance she was arrested along with 31 other protestors in 2009 as she fought against mountaintop removal, a form of surface mining, in West Virginia in an effort to stop the harmful practice in the area.

David Carradine

David Carradine played the infamous Bill in the original Kill Bill movie. In the movie Bill was the main antagonist of the thriller and the leader of the Deadly Viper Assassination Squad with the code-name "Snake Charmer." Bill was Beautrix Kiddo's love interest and was later killed by her using a fatal martial art strike.

During David's impressive run in Hollywood spanning over six decades he starred in 200 major and minor roles including in film, television, and on stage. He was well-known for a number of films showcasing his incredible acting abilities some of which Boxcar Bertha, Big Stan, Death Race 2000, The Long Riders, Cannonball, and many more.

David died at the age of 72 years old after he was found dead in his hotel room in central Bangkok. The famous actor was found naked and had hung himself in the room's closet with a curtain cord. According to police, he had appeared to be deceased for at least 12 hours with no signs of struggle. Police suggested that his death could've been due to accidental suffocation following auto-erotic asphyxiation as there was no suicide note and he was discovered with a rope around both his neck and genitals.

After David's death was remembered as an inspiring figures for actors everywhere. He once said: "The problem is not that acting is hard. The problem is that there are over 100,000 members of SAG, and only hundreds of jobs," he continued: "There was one guy who once told me, there are no failures in Hollywood, there are only people who gave up too soon.”
